decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall begin not later than three years from the date of this decision.

Reason: In order to comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990, as amended by Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004.

Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and specifications: [LP01, E300, E400-A, E403, Heritage, Design and Access Statement and Flood Risk Assessment. Received: 06/06/2024
Street Photos and Structural Report. Received: 17/07/2024
P300-A, P400-A, P401-A, P402-A, P403-A and P404-A. Received: 31/07/2024].
Reason: In order to ensure the development is carried out in accordance with the planning permission.

Condition : 3 - The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the development hereby permitted shall match those used in the existing building, unless otherwise shown on the approved plans.
Reason: In order to safeguard the appearance of the area.

Condition : 4 - The window to be fitted on the side roof face of the dwelling shall be black-framed and traditional, conservation-style.
Reason: In order to safeguard the architectural and historic interest of the conservation area
description: Removal of the rear chimney stub, installation of a centred larger window on the third storey rear elevation, one side roof window and roof solar panels
